Reviews.Title: Great BASIC Phone
Reviews.Author: J. Jacobson "Concerned About a Better World"
Reviews.Content: I've had my 6010 for years.  It just never breaks down, never locks up, never goes wierd.  I've fallen back to it several times, once after my blackberry became quirky, and once with an international phone.  Originally, I purchased a much more expensive spiffy phone with camera, bells and whistles.  I brought it back to exchange for this phone failing to get a clear line.  I live in a poor reception area.  The sales person said the signal would be better and there would be less hassels.  He was right.  I can always depend on this little fellow.  It doesn't look like much, but I am secure that my calls will happen when I want them to.  This is a great back up, no headache phone.

Reviews.Title: Reliable, cheap phone-and only a phone
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Simple, well built, excellent battery life; the 6010 is a great phone-and that's all it is.There's no easy way to move information/addresses to the phone-no bluetooth, no included cable.  There are 3rd party cable's available.The keyboard is large and is great for dialing in the middle of the night (like I do). I think it has one of the largest number keypad's of any phone.I've dropped this phone numerous times, and it hasn't had any problems.If you only want a mobile phone with nothing else, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Candybar, almost Waterproof/Shockproof!!
Reviews.Author: CuffLadyNYC
Reviews.Content: That's even much better than the other reviewer mentioned: IT has its web browser which works pretty well, not a just-a-phone thing, it is a cute one with a decent keyboard, good for guys always complaining of their fingers not fitting ok...!Works with instant communicators! Yahoo, AIM & AOL, it's its coolest feature, indeed! For weeks connected to yahoo, and at the same time using the phone, as well!Every now and then dropped on the park, 10feet high to catch it alive and well, down the hill... Lots of ringtones, one for each buddy call, or sms, very much a user-friendly phone.Charge last much more than my other Motorolas, maybe more than 2 times longer. Bought a second spare one, maybe for the times I cannot find a new one available, one year or so from now...!!On the side I have a Motorola C650, just for the camera when its warm outside, but can't leave my 6010 at home, just love it!

Reviews.Title: Great phone that got here fast
Reviews.Author: Keith P. Knippa "Zymergist"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the phone.  Just needed a basic phone after the phone at&t; gave me broke.  I took the sim card out of my broken phone and put in this one and it worked great from the start.  This phone works in places that my wife's will not.

Reviews.Title: Phone from Hassel Free
Reviews.Author: John from St Charles
Reviews.Content: The first phone I got had problems with the soft key. I took it on vacation and when I came back I told 'Hassel Free' about the problem. They said this was not normal and to send it back and they would send me another one.They did. I got my replacement within 10 days and it works fine ! I have nothing but praise.Thanks .....

Reviews.Title: simple is good
Reviews.Author: J. G.
Reviews.Content: These phones are to replace the same 3 year old phones. My parents, 90 & 89,  have no trouble seeing or using  the buttons. Took  the chip out of the old cell and into the new no problem. I on the other hand got my new one from the cell company who did not have the same phone. Can not see the screen in daylight and some light rooms and the buttons are a nightmare. If you don't need a camera or flip postage stamp size phone, get this one.

Reviews.Title: CHEAP PRICE GOOD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Debbie H.
Reviews.Content: THE PHONE THAT I RECEIVED LOOK NEW AND WORKS VERY WELL.  FOR THEPRICE THAT I PAID FOR THE PHONE, EXCELLENT DEAL.  DEBBIE IN WV

Reviews.Title: Amazing for how it looks
Reviews.Author: L. Bell
Reviews.Content: I thought that this phone was a piece of junk. I mean, it doesn't even have a camera! I have a propel and my mom has this one in black. When Gustav turned off our power, my phone wouldn't work at all. But my mom's kept going! And when we go to a store like JcPenny in Lafayette, my propel and my sister's sony erisson lose reception almost instanly. My mom's just keeps on going. I'm keeping my propel for how stylish it is...but this little baby is going in my purse as a back up! I'll just get a cute face plate for it.

Reviews.Title: Great cell phone!
Reviews.Author: Jeany London
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a phone that will call and/or text people and the Nokia 6010 fulfilled my needs and wants! I'm glad it's unlocked because I am an AT&T; user and the cell phone was made for T-Mobile, lol. I laugh all the time because I remember when these types of cell phones (that didn't have a colored screen) were the "it" phones back in my days, lol.If you used to have or use a cell phone with a keyboard or whatever, it'll take some time for you to get used to but it's really no big deal. Because I went from the iPhone to Nokia 6010, yep... it's a big change for me. :)

Reviews.Title: simple and easy
Reviews.Author: SHEILA PAYNE "loves water"
Reviews.Content: the phone is great if you need a easy to do phone i just wish it was a little smaller to fit in my pants pocket better but its a good phone

Reviews.Title: back to just using a phone for a phone
Reviews.Author: William R. Thon
Reviews.Content: I got this in 2005 and used it until about 09 then moved on to fancier. well this February I got it out put the sim back in and ordered an 8 dollar battery. it is nice to go a week between charges and the reception is better than the other phones I tried to use. Going to stick with this for awhile

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone
Reviews.Author: D. Houston "Legal Eagle"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Nokia 6010 model cellphone for several years now, getting it new from T-mobile years ago.  The phone has worked every time, gets great reception compared to other models I have used (a few dropped calls, but that is the network not the phone) and replacement batteries have been cheap to buy when needed.  If you need just a basic phone and this model will work on your network, buy this phone. I have now changed to a more fancy and expensive Motorola phone and have put Spiderman faceplates on this Nokia 6010 model so it will serve as my grandson's first phone.  No complaints after many years of usage.

Reviews.Title: excellent service
Reviews.Author: Anita C. Bick "adbick"
Reviews.Content: I received this phone very quickly.  I bought it for my mother and she had a problem with the battery.  I had no problems at all with getting a new one.  Excellent service with the seller.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: William E. Young "Bartolucci"
Reviews.Content: The keypad had died about a month ago.  I had been shopping for a replacement phone in that time and I couldn't find anything that I liked.  Especially since I'd lose the majority of my contacts if I switched phones!  So I decided to buy this.  It was the perfect choice: great price, fast delivery and easy installation.  Was talking with my family 5 minutes after receiving the order.

Reviews.Title: Astonishing reliability and durability for a basic "dumbphone"
Reviews.Author: Spaceneedleboy
Reviews.Content: I purchased and activated my Nokia 6010 in May, 2006 and am still using it today (T-Mobile is my carrier).  While I am gradually thinking about getting a "smartphone", I probably WILL NOT get rid of my Nokia 6010 or its dedicated phone number.  Reason:  This is a traditional cell phone which is astonishingly durable.  It has fallen hard on the floor a few times.  The battery life is very long - although I have this cell phone turned off fairly often, there are other times I leave it on all day, and generally I recharge the battery every two weeks.  Recharging the battery only takes about an hour.  Trust me, smartphones need very frequent battery recharging.The Nokia 6010 has very good reception, subject to the occasional geographic limitations of T-Mobile's GSM cell tower network.  Voice audio quality is easy to understand and clear.  The buttons are fairly large, it's easy to learn the functions on this phone.  The display is fairly easy to read, for viewing text messages, dialed or received numbers, and similar information.The only real drawback to the Nokia 6010, and the other vintage Nokia "chocolate bar" cell phones (as distinguished from the more-commonplace "flip phone" designs), is that when the unit is turned on, it is too easy to bump some of the keys and start typing out a phone number or some other type of command.This is the "Swiss Army Knife" of basic "dumbphones".  The very long battery life is a huge plus, particularly if you are facing emergency conditions such as an extended power outage.  Even if you love your smartphone, you may want to consider activating an inexpensive but durable "dumbphone" such as this as a backup device for voice calls, in the event that your beloved smartphone becomes broken, damaged, stolen or electronically malfunctioning - while eventually you can get a replacement, it would be nice to retain a working "dumbphone" with its own dedicated cell phone number as an interim communications device.In summary, I have personally used the Nokia 6010 as my primary wireless phone for 7 years and 7 months.  It still works for its intended purpose.  If you value simplicity, durability and reliability in the design of electronic products, this remains a good choice for a perfectly-functional "dumbphone".

Reviews.Title: Awesome for phone calls
Reviews.Author: shery
Reviews.Content: My dad loves these phone. He will never change. He will always buy a new phone and the Nokia 6010 will be it ! This phone like they say, "If it falls, the floor will break, not the phone" And yes my kitchen floor DID actually break...Kidding.Well I don't recommend this phone cause im 14 years old duh. But my dad does, He only makes phone calls SO HE LOVES IT !

Reviews.Title: Still use mine since 2001
Reviews.Author: Jojopuppyfish
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to buy a new phone and just transfered my simm card.I pay $40/ month from T-Mobile and really don't need a smart phone.The quality of the calls are great.  Great signal.People laugh at me when I show them my phone, but I save more money than them.

Reviews.Title: Die Hard
Reviews.Author: Brian Forrest
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing cell phone, a real die hard that can take being knocked about without falling apart. I have had mine for 8 years and it's still working fine. If yours is locked, it is easy to find unlock codes online and follow the instructions to turn the SIM card restriction off.

Reviews.Title: Holds a charge!
Reviews.Author: Phil Bourassa
Reviews.Content: I got this phone in 2006 and used it until January 2013, due to pressures to upgrade to a Smartphone.  Doing so makes me appreciate this oldie, which is sturdy and HOLDS A CHARGE in standby mode for at least week. (The Smartphone is fun, but needs charging almost everyday.)  I'm tempted to go back to this old reliable simple friend, even though it lacks a decent keyboard and internet access.

Reviews.Title: Technology has moved on
Reviews.Author: Jason Walters
Reviews.Content: The SIM card that goes in my current ATT phone is not compatible with this technology- therefore it is unusable.

Reviews.Title: Nopkia 6010
Reviews.Author: Doris Hairston
Reviews.Content: Husband loved his phone old school can't get him to upgrade key pad numbers to small. hope you have more in stock:-)

Reviews.Title: Neigh indestructible.
Reviews.Author: Anonymouse
Reviews.Content: An ancient phone forged with indestructible magic, from back when cellphones were built to last. Over the course of six years it has been dropped from buildings, kicked, dunked briefly in water and still remains in excellent working order.

Reviews.Title: used cell phone
Reviews.Author: Daniel W. Moulton
Reviews.Content: I am completely satisfied with the cell phone and charger. They both work. I expected nothing less.

Reviews.Title: Finally a phone that gets good reception
Reviews.Author: Nina Colvin "Nina"
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th phone I have tried with ATT service and it has the best reception.  I have lost a signal twice since I started using it, but that is nothing like the other phones I have tried.  It is just a basic phone, but it is reliable and holds a charge well.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: BH
Reviews.Content: I washed my husbands other phone, which had more bells & whistles, but never picked up very well-never really liked it. Ordered this one as an inexpensive replacement, as we used to have a similar one years ago. Picks up great, good reception. Great basic phone, not a lot of extra stuff we don't use; heavy enough so I can hopefully feel it in his pocket next time I do laundry. Have had it about a month, no complaints for what we need it for: talking, occ. texting.

Reviews.Title: Cell Phone Review
Reviews.Author: Sherrie L. Pugh "Sherrie"
Reviews.Content: This is exactly the phone I wanted, and was so happy to have found it. However, the #3 and #5 stick BAD!!! I did send email to seller, but no response. I am not very happy with the phone, and find it hard to believe that it was actually new if the number stick. Unfortunately all my number are 359 or 581 so difficult at best.

Reviews.Title: Do noy buy this
Reviews.Author: Reza Sharghi-moshtaghin "Reza"
Reviews.Content: The cover is plastic.The signal reception is noty as good as it is mentioned in the reviews.I returned this item try another cell phone.

Reviews.Title: malfunctioning product
Reviews.Author: red orc
Reviews.Content: this was terrible - did not work, I am thinking that the old product had been in original case for so long that the battery was completely dead (not responding to charging). Bought an Iphone instead of wasting time on this garbage

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
Dual-band GSM 850/1900 cell phone with GPRS data capabilities
Compatible with X-Press On front and rear faceplates
SMS text/MMS picture messaging; T9 predictive text entry; organizer
Up to 5.5 hours of talk time and 10 days of standby time
ProductInfo.Name: Nokia 6010 Unlocked Cell Phone--U.S. Version with Warranty (Silver)
